passages.name: Then you walk to the party.
passages.text: As you walk, you hear faint murmurs.\n\n[[They see you.|]]

passages.name: Day4
passages.text: <big><big>Day [[Four|day4new]]</big></big>

passages.name: Day2
passages.text: <big><big>Day [[Two|day2new]]</big></big>

passages.name: Sounds good
passages.text: Jacobson nods.

passages.name: Why did you laugh?
passages.text: She shrugs, removing the hand from her mouth and putting it on the desk. "I don't know. It's funny I guess? I mean, I didn't think that happened to men. Especially a man like you." [[Fuck you.]] [[What do you mean, a man like me?]]

links.text: What do you mean, a man like me?

destination.name: What do you mean, a man like me?

passages.name: Step outside
passages.text:
You step outside, take a walk.  Upon seeing you the ghosts approach, surrounding you, whispering.
Today their presence feels choking, and their whispers are overwhelming you.  But they need someone to hear them.  And you are the only one.
[[Take out your notebook.  Write down their words.]]
[[Shoo them away.  You can't do this right now.]]

links.text: Take out your notebook.  Write down their words.

destination.name: Take out your notebook.  Write down their words.

links.text: Shoo them away.  You can't do this right now.

destination.name: Shoo them away.  You can't do this right now.

passages.name: You open it.
passages.text: The balcony looks out at the city lights, twinkling down below.  Floating at the edge is a ghost, just like they said there would be.\nYou look around.  The only other folks here are all the way on the opposite side.  Should be nothing to worry about.\n[[Hopefully.|]]

passages.name: Something bad happened today.
passages.text:
She frowns.  "What?  Were you fired?"
"No.  Nothing like that."
"Then what happened?"
[[Someone . . . hurt me tonight.]]
[[Just some trouble with Jacobson.  It'll work out.]]

links.text: Just some trouble with Jacobson.  It'll work out.

destination.name: Just some trouble with Jacobson.  It'll work out.

passages.name: Untitled Passage 1
passages.text: "In any case."  She stops writing and takes the completed draft from the typewriter, standing up.  "I have to head out.  Got a story to catch in California.  Jacobson's orders."\n[[Ooh.  Have fun!|Bleave]]\n[[Oof.  Good luck.|Bleave]]

passages.name: I can't.  Talk.  About.  It.
passages.text: Bridget leans back.  "Alright.  Can't blame me for guessing," she teases.  Her face turns serious when she says, "But I'm here if you need an ear.  Ok?"\n[[Thanks.  I appreciate it.]]\n[[Thanks.  But I can't talk about it.]]

links.text: Thanks.  But I can't talk about it.

destination.name: Thanks.  But I can't talk about it.

passages.name: title
passages.text:
<big><big><big>Bi Lines</big></big></big>
<big>(alternate title: Living the Day After)</big>

<big>a possession by Naomi Norbez.  Spiritual successor to [[Arizona Craters|https://norbez.itch.io/arizona-craters]] & [[GIVE IT TIME|https://norbez.itch.io/give-it-time]].</big>

Warning: This game contains content relating to sexual assualt, biphobia, homophobia, suicide, queer slurs, and swear words.

[[Proceed.|1starticle]]

passages.name: And in a moment, he's gone from this plane.
passages.text: It seems he got what he needed from this world.\n[[You walk home.|home]]

passages.name: whytalk
passages.text: "Close," Mom says.  "You can see them because you're my son.  But you can talk to them the same reason they can talk to you: some striving within your soul that wants to be plugged up."\n[[Is that why you made them talk to me?  Because you want me to be like you?]]

links.text: Is that why you made them talk to me?  Because you want me to be like you?

destination.name: Is that why you made them talk to me?  Because you want me to be like you?

passages.name: Someone I interviewed.
passages.text: "Sheesh."  Samantha sighs, shaking her head.  "Some people can be real jerks.  So, did you file a police report?  Are you going to sue?"\n[[I'm thinking about it.|policereport]]\n[[I don't know yet.|policereport]]

passages.name: Not like I have a choice
Not much I can do.  Not really
passages.text: Bridget nods.  "Ok.  That's good."  She stands up, puts her chair back behind her desk.  "Writing it down might help," she says.

passages.name: StoryTitle
passages.text: Bi Lines

passages.name: He violated me.  And I hated it.  But some part of me liked it.
passages.text: Samantha frowns. "I'm sorry, what?!" You swallow hard. Seeing the look on her face, you wish you kept those words buried in your throat, where they belong. "What, are you queer or something?" she asks, her gaze accusatory. [[Maybe? I'm not really sure.|gfmad]] [[That's really not the point here. . .|gfmad]]

links.text: That's really not the point here. . .

passages.name: day2new
passages.text:
You wake up.<<if $breakup is 1>>

You leave the bedroom, expecting to see Samantha on the couch.  But she's gone.
You still feel dirty.  For a lot of reasons.<<else>><<endif>>

Your thoughts are restless.  [[You decide to go to work.|d2work]]

links.text: You decide to go to work.

passages.name: Let them come.  No point in fighting it.
Let him take you
passages.text: You close your eyes and let him in, even as every part of you wants him purged.  He reaches down and runs a hand down your arm, down your chest, [[down to the erect thing between your legs.|assault]]\n\n[[You feel him smile around your lips.|assault]]

links.text: down to the erect thing between your legs.
You feel him smile around your lips.

passages.name: What did you want from killing yourself?
passages.text:
"That easy.  I wanted to get rid of the pain," he says, his face flat.
"Then maybe whatever it is, whatever's giving you pain, isn't letting you rest," you say to him.
The boy's eyes widen.  ". . . You might be right," he says finally."
"Think about it," you tell him.  "The others will tell me once you realize what's keeping you here.  And then I'll be back to help."
[[With that, you exit the balcony, and leave the party.|homeghost]]

links.text: With that, you exit the balcony, and leave the party.

passages.name: You leave his office.
passages.text: You close the door silently behind you, and walk over to your desk.  Sitting down at your chair, you look around the office.\nCompared to others you've written for, the place is tiny but dignified.  You've found it fitting for such a small publication, but at the same time, it's hard to walk around such a cramped office.\n[[Then again, Jacobson lets you write those interviews every issue.  Which is why you came here in the first place.|]]

links.text: Then again, Jacobson lets you write those interviews every issue.  Which is why you came here in the first place.

destination.name: Then again, Jacobson lets you write those interviews every issue.  Which is why you came here in the first place.

links.text: Yeah.  But I don't really know what I can do to help you.

destination.name: Yeah.  But I don't really know what I can do to help you.

links.text: I don't want to pursue this realtionship further.

passages.name: Nope.
passages.text: "Darn," Bridget teases.  She shrugs.  "Ah well.  See you on the front page next month.  Again."\n[[Thanks]]\n[[You too]]

passages.name: If you're really sorry, don't read my stuff like that again.
passages.text: Jacobson is caught off guard.  "Of. . . Of course," he says.  "I will do that.  Sorry for asking about it."\nHe walks away.

passages.name: Bleave
passages.text: "Thanks."  She throws on her jacket, straightens her tie.  "I'll see you tomorrow evening.  Have a good one, yeah?"\n[[You too.|Bleave2]]\n[[Thanks.|Bleave2]]

passages.name: day3mom
passages.text: [[mom article here|day3]]

passages.name: Just a beer.
passages.text:
The bartender nods.  "Sure thing."
A moment later, he comes back with a full cup and places it in front of you.  Then, without looking back, he walks over to the next person.
You take a sip.  It's pretty good.  Better be good, for some of the richest folks in the city.  Not that you're one of them, you're just along for the ride.
[[But you can pretend.|partyend]]

passages.name: day4GFdinner
passages.text:
You go home to your girlfriend.  You go out to dinner.  At the end of the meal, you clear your throat.
"Samantha."
She looks up.  "Yes?"
[[I want to spend the rest of my life with you]]
[[I don't know if I can be with you anymore]]

links.text: I want to spend the rest of my life with you

destination.name: I want to spend the rest of my life with you

links.text: I don't know if I can be with you anymore

destination.name: I don't know if I can be with you anymore

passages.name: You go to the bar
passages.text:
There aren't many at the bar yet.  Two people, a woman and a man a bit younger than most at his party, are sharing a beer together.  They look related--perhaps children of one of the folks here?

"I'm not here to be interviewed," the senator grunts.  "I'm here to drink.  Drink with me if you'd like."
[[Sure, I'll drink with you.]]
[[No, I'll drink by myself]]

passages.name: Maybe there's a person you want to speak to one more time?
passages.text:
The boy shrugs.  "I doubt it.  No one I'm really attached to besides my family.  And things haven't been good with them lately."
He seems to realize something.  "But maybe.  I gotta think about this.  Ok."
"Of course."  You nod.  "Think about it.  The others will send word once you know why you're here."
[[You leave the balcony and exit the party.|homeghost]]

links.text: You leave the balcony and exit the party.

passages.name: No, let's explore exactly what you meant by that.
I don't believe in God.  Not anymore.
passages.text: "Damn shame," the senator grunts.  "'Cuz he sure believes in you, kid."\nYou say nothing.  [[You just take a sip of your drink.|partyend]]

links.text: You just take a sip of your drink.

passages.name: Typewriter_from_hell
Try to think about something else.  Need to find some calm.
Yeah, it's true.
passages.text: He smiles. His smile melts you. "Rad. It's good to have someone so willing to help those who are stuck."\nHe reaches out, and puts a hand on your shoulder. "So they were right," he says with surprise. "You can be touched by us."\n[[He gazes into you.|FUCK]]

passages.name: day2-1
passages.text: Sometimes the ghost's final longing was to be painted, so in those cases it was two birds in one stone. But most required different things. And mom did them all. She chopped firewood, drove to memorials, found old treasures. \n[[She let them rest.|day2-2]]

passages.name: day2-3
passages.text: [[But eventually, the weight of it crushed her.|Day2]]

links.text: But eventually, the weight of it crushed her.

passages.name: day2-2
passages.text: If there was one thing I learned from her, it was to always [[bear love on your shoulders|day2-3]], passing out pieces and carrying in carefully on your back.

passages.name: Perhaps it would.
passages.text: He grins.  "Fantastic.  And remember, I need that piece in three days--just in time for her birthday, after all.\n"Alright, get out of here.  We got lots to do." He places your interview on his desk and starts working on something else.  [[Your signal to leave.|You leave his office.]]

links.text: I doubt I can find an interview.

destination.name: I doubt I can find an interview.

passages.name: Shoo them away.  You can't do this right now.
passages.text:
"Stop," you hiss at them, gritting your teeth so your lips don't move.  "Not today.  Tomorrow."
The ghosts stop.  After a long moment, they disperce, one by one, back to the darkness in which they came.
You take a deep breath.  Your heart is beating fast, but as you walk, it slows.  When you get back to the office, you are calmer, though your hands still shake.
[[From the cold?  From the fear?  It's hard to tell.|backinoffice]]

links.text: From the cold?  From the fear?  It's hard to tell.

passages.name: 1article2
passages.text: A friend got a bunch of huskies and let them play on the lawn. She sketched a few of them, [[then got to painting.|1article3]]

passages.name: home
passages.text: <>When you open the door, Samantha is in the kitchen, pouring herself a glass of water. "Hey babe," she says, smiling at you. "How was work?" [[It was fine.]] [[I need to take a shower]]<>When you open the door, your silent apartment greets you. No ghosts here. Thank God. Whatever God is. You feel an undesirable urge to shower. But another part of you insists you don't deserve a shower, that the best thing is to flop on the couch and sleep. [[Shower]] [[Sleep]]<>

links.text: I need to take a shower

destination.name: I need to take a shower

passages.name: I'll just have a beer.
passages.text:
The bartender nods.  "Sure thing."  You wonder if you've offended him.
A moment later, he comes back with a full cup and places it in front of you.  Then, without looking back, he walks over to the next person.
You take a sip.  It's pretty good.  Better be good, for some of the richest folks in the city.  Not that you're one of them, you're just along for the ride.
[[But you can pretend.|partyend]]

passages.name: 1article6
passages.text: And I knew it was for [[more than just the two dogs.|Day1]]

links.text: more than just the two dogs.

passages.name: 1article4
passages.text: My mother laughed, glancing up from her brush strokes. "Of course not, sweetie. They're [[two boy dogs|1article5]]. They can't make babies together. Only a girl dog and a boy dog can do that."

passages.name: 1article5
passages.text: Even though I was young, I sensed a [[calm contempt|1article6]] in her voice.

passages.name: Thanks.  I appreciate it.
passages.text: Bridget nods.  "Sure thing."

passages.name: day2
passages.text: People came to mom. Drifters, spirits. Those with tasks left to do. [[And she would help them. In exchange, she would paint them--or at least, how she saw them.|day2-1]]

links.text: And she would help them.  In exchange, she would paint them--or at least, how she saw them.

passages.name: day3
passages.text: <big><big>Day [[Three|day3new]]</big></big>

passages.name: coffeeSure
passages.text: He pours you a cup and hands it to you.  "Sent Bridget to California this morning," he says, sipping his own coffee.  "Heard there's an outbreak there.  Serious stuff.  Want to be the first to report on it."\n[[Sounds good]]\n[[Think she'll be alright?]]

passages.name: I think that'll help.
passages.text: She lays down, and you lay down next to her. Her arm trails onto your hip, the same way his did before.\n[[Lean into her. To find comfort.]]\n[[Ask her not to touch you. To find relief.]]

links.text: Lean into her.  To find comfort.

destination.name: Lean into her.  To find comfort.

links.text: Ask her not to touch you.  To find relief.

destination.name: Ask her not to touch you.  To find relief.

passages.name: backinoffice
passages.text: Jacobson's pouring coffee when you enter.  He holds up the pot.  "Want some?" he grunts.\n[[Sure|coffeeSure]]\n[[No thanks.]]

passages.name: Head to the bar.  Relax.
passages.text:
You walk over to the bar.  There aren't many folks here yet.  Perhaps most are waiting until midnight to drown themselves in hangovers.
You sit at a stool.  The bartender approaches, a rugged man with a curly beard and rich, brown eyes.  He smiles warmly, and makes your heart melt.
"What can I get you?"
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"[[Just a beer.]]"
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"[[Are you avalible this evening?]]"
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

passages.name: It's time to go.
passages.text: You grab the usual materials: pen, pencil, notebook, tape recorder.  Ready for anything.\n[[You leave the office and head toward the party.|Then you walk to the party.]]

links.text: You leave the office and head toward the party.

destination.name: Then you walk to the party.

passages.name: I don't know if I can be with you anymore
I've already figured out some things about myself.
passages.text: "Whatever you say, youngin'," he says.  "You'll see.  You'll change.  People always do.  You think you know yourself, but you'll settle into the better version of you soon enough.  God bless that."\n[[Amen]]\n[[I don't believe in God.  Not anymore.]]

links.text: I don't believe in God.  Not anymore.

destination.name: I don't believe in God.  Not anymore.

passages.name: Yeah.  I'm fine.
passages.text: She breathes a sigh of relief. "Well, that's good to hear."\nShe leans against you, tracing her hand on your chest, right where he touched you tonight. "Let's try to get some sleep," she says. "[[I think that'll help.]]"

passages.name: Thanks.  But I can't talk about it.
passages.text: Bridget nods, concern washing over her face.  "Alright.  If you say so."

passages.name: Jcomplaint
passages.text: "That's not good."

links.text: Haven't quite celebrated it since she passed.

destination.name: Haven't quite celebrated it since she passed.

passages.name: Oh.
passages.text: "Yep."  He clears his throat.  "So first of all, I want to apologize.  For reading it.  It was private.  But also, have you contacted the police?  About . . . that?"\n[[If you're really sorry, don't read my stuff like that again.]]\n[[I can't contact the police.  They won't believe me.]]

links.text: If you're really sorry, don't read my stuff like that again.

destination.name: If you're really sorry, don't read my stuff like that again.

links.text: I can't contact the police.  They won't believe me.

destination.name: I can't contact the police.  They won't believe me.

passages.name: homeghost
passages.text:
On the way home, you nearly run into a figure.  
"Excuse m--"  You stop.
A ghost.  You haven't seen this one before  Is it new here?
"Hey there."  The man gives you a translucent grin.  "Word around here is that you're the guy who can help us let go of this plane.  Is that true?"
"[[Yeah, it's true.]]"
"[[Why do you ask?]]"

passages.name: As I was saying. . .
passages.text: "As I was saying," you tell Bridget, trying to find the friend you know in her.  "I was attacked.  And I

passages.name: if Bridget saw you talk to ghosts
passages.text: As soon as you step out the office for the night, Bridget marches over and drags you outside.  "Ow, ow, ow!" you exclaim as she drags you over to the elevator.  "What's going on?"\n"We're getting coffee," she says, sending you two down.  "Just you and me.  And you're going to give things to me straight."

passages.name: I suppose you're right, Senator.
passages.text: "Yes I am," the man says.  "You'll see."\n[[You try to focus on the Senator and not the two across the bar.|partyend]]

links.text: You try to focus on the Senator and not the two across the bar.

passages.name: Maybe there's something you still want to do in this life?
passages.text:
The boy scratches his translucent head.  "Could be?  I gave up on school and college, so it can't be that.  Maybe something else.  But I gave up on everything when I jumped."
He smiles.  "Guess that's something I gotta think about, huh?"
"Yep."  You smile back.
[[You leave.|homeghost]]

passages.name: The man who did this doesn't exist
passages.text:
Jacobson's brows go from furious to relaxed.  "Oh."  For some reason, he laughs.  "Oh, I understand now.
"You were writing a fictional account," he says, smiling.  "You're working on some short story, is that it?"
[[. . . Yeah.  Exactly.]]
[[No.  It's not a story.]]

passages.name: Untitled Passage 3
passages.text: "You know why you can talk to them?" Mom asks.\n[[Because you could talk to them?|whytalk]]\n[[Because I'm lucky?|whytalk]]

links.text: Because you could talk to them?
What did you want from killing yourself?

destination.name: What did you want from killing yourself?

passages.name: momtalk
passages.text: You sigh. "Mom, when will you decide to go?" She frowns. "When I understand what I did to make you . . . like this. / When you're married, of course. We've discussed this." "And if I never get married?" She shrugs. "Then I can take comfort in the fact that you never tied the knot some someone the same sex as you." She wags her finger and tisks-tisks. "My child is not a homosexual." [[No, I'm not.]] [[Yes, I am. Partially.]]

passages.name: you're the only human who can see and touch them
passages.text: By the time the ghosts disperse, your notepad is filled with new requests and interviews.  Giving souls peace is not an easy job.\nBut it can wait.\n[[You've reached the party|]]

passages.name: Untitled Passage 2
passages.text:
<<if $write is 1>>"Listen."  Jacobson scratches his head awkwardly.  Which is something he never does.  "While you were gone, I saw what you were writing," he says.  He speaks quietly, even though no one else is in the office yet.  "I thought it was a new interview, so I decided to take a peek.  And it was . . . not what I expected."
[[Oh.]]
[[You shouldn't have read my stuff without my permission.]]
<<else>>"So, Jacobson asks, taking a sip of coffee, "how was the party last night?"<<endif>>

links.text: You shouldn't have read my stuff without my permission.

destination.name: You shouldn't have read my stuff without my permission.

passages.name: I guess you're right.
passages.text: Jacobson smiles, takes a piece of paper out of his pocket.  "Tell them Jacobson Terry is your boss," he says.  "They'll listen."\nHe walks away.

passages.name: Yeah.  Too tired to talk.
passages.text: Alright. Let's get some sleep." She lays down, and you lay down next to her. Her arm trails onto your hip, the same way his did before. [[Lean into her. To find comfort.]] [[Ask her not to touch you. To find relief.]]

links.text: Lean into her.  To find comfort.

destination.name: Lean into her.  To find comfort.

links.text: Ask her not to touch you.  To find relief.

destination.name: Ask her not to touch you.  To find relief.

passages.name: Jump
passages.text:
You jump.
The force of the water kills you instantly.
[[Your body sinks down, and your heart with it.|day3mom]]
<<set $dead to 1>>

links.text: Your body sinks down, and your heart with it.

passages.name: d2work
passages.text: You step into the office. Not many people are here yet. Except, of course, the one who's always early: [[the one who's closer to a friend than a coworker.]]

links.text: the one who's closer to a friend than a coworker.

destination.name: the one who's closer to a friend than a coworker.

passages.name: Enjoy the party.
passages.text:
Things are already well on their way.  Powerful people are chatting amongst themselves, no doubt discussing their plans for the future.  Some are giving interviews to the press, surrounded by reporters scribbling rapidly in their notepads or desperately stretching their microphone toward the stream of important words.
You don't see any ghosts yet, but there have to be some here.  There always are some at events like these, with people like them.
The food is buffet style, and some are already eating.  And a few people are at the bar already.
You're here on a mission.  But perhaps it would be good to indulge a little.  Give yourself time to have fun.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[[Head to the bar.  Relax.]]
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[[Do what you came for.  Focus.]]
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

links.text: Do what you came for.  Focus.

destination.name: Do what you came for.  Focus.

passages.name: Well, he needs to hear that, don't you think?
StoryAuthor
passages.text: Naomi Norbez

passages.name: You shouldn't have read my stuff without my permission.
passages.text: "I know.  I'm sorry about that."  He clears his throat.  "But also, have you contacted the police?  About . . . what happened there?"\n[[If you're really sorry, don't read my stuff like that again.]]\n[[I can't contact the police.  They won't believe me.]]

links.text: If you're really sorry, don't read my stuff like that again.

destination.name: If you're really sorry, don't read my stuff like that again.

links.text: I can't contact the police.  They won't believe me.

destination.name: I can't contact the police.  They won't believe me.

passages.name: bedalone
passages.text: You never bothered to buy a matteress since you live by yourself.  Now, putting on your PJs to sleep on your small couch, you regret it--a big bed could provide the illusion of comfort.\nBut there's nothing to be done about that now.\nYou lie down on your couch and lean your head against one of the arms.  [[After hours of tossing and turning and squirming, you finally fall asleep.|day2]]

links.text: After hours of tossing and turning and squirming, you finally fall asleep.

passages.name: Like I said, it's a secret.  I have connections.

links.text: Not like I have a choice

destination.name: Not like I have a choice

passages.name: policereport
passages.text: Samantha leans against you, tracing her hand on your chest. Right where he touched you. "Ok," she says, listening to you breathe. "It's up to you, ok?"\n[[Ok. Thanks.]]

passages.name: Yes.
passages.text: She stands up, and takes your hand.  "Come on, then.\n\n"[[Let's go.|title]]"

passages.name: bridge
passages.text: You stop at the edge of the bridge.  The water looks tempting.\n[[Jump]]\n[[Don't]]

passages.name: With one tiny wave of your finger, they approach.
passages.text:
When you were younger, you had trouble processing all of the ghosts' whispers.  But now you're used to this daily routine.  As they come nearer, you w hip out your notebook, and start jotting down their words.
"General Berand would like to speak with you," one says.  "I've organized a meeting with him.  We're still working out a safe address. . ."
"I talked to Ian Knox, and he said to 'shove that interview up your ass'," another whispers.  "His words.  I have a feeling he'll change his mind though--he's still here because he has some things to say."
"Kimberly liked the article you wrote about her," one more announces.  "[[She faded to heaven after reading it this morning.  You fulfilled her duties,|giving you a thankful smile.]]" the ghost says, giving you a thankful smile.

links.text: She faded to heaven after reading it this morning.  You fulfilled her duties,

passages.name: No, it's not that.
passages.text: "Then what's up?"  She stops typing, arches an eyebrow.  "You seriously look terrible."\n[[It's nothing I want to talk about.]]\n[[Something kinda serious happened last night.]]

links.text: It's nothing I want to talk about.

destination.name: It's nothing I want to talk about.

links.text: Something kinda serious happened last night.

destination.name: Something kinda serious happened last night.

passages.name: It's nothing I want to talk about.
passages.text: "Alright."  Bridget shrugs, gives you a teasing but reassuring smile.  "I should probably mind my own damn business anyway.  But if you need an ear, I got you, ok?"\n[[Thanks.  I appreciate it.]]\n[[Thanks.  But I can't talk about it.]]

links.text: Thanks.  But I can't talk about it.

destination.name: Thanks.  But I can't talk about it.

passages.name: You will.  You're the better writer.
passages.text: "Don't let Jacobson hear you say that," she says.  "He's still drooling all over your pieces."\n[[Ok.  It can be our secret.]]\n[[Well, he needs to hear that, don't you think?]]

links.text: Ok.  It can be our secret.

destination.name: Ok.  It can be our secret.

links.text: Well, he needs to hear that, don't you think?

destination.name: Well, he needs to hear that, don't you think?

passages.name: Start
passages.text:
She sits across from you in the diner, not interested in the food, but clearly interested in you.  Your friend of her friend was right; you two really match.
"Anything else I should know about you?" Samantha asks.  She smiles, holds out her hand.  "Other than that you're the man of my dreams."
You blush, slipping your fingers between hers.  It's likely she doesn't know.  Perhaps it's best to keep it that way?
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"[[I also like guys.  I think.]]"
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"[[No, nothing else.]]"
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

links.text: I also like guys.  I think.

destination.name: I also like guys.  I think.

passages.name: Like I said, they won't believe me
passages.text: Jacobson hesitates.  Then, he sighs.  "If you say so.  I'll let it be.  You need me, I'll be in my office."\nHe walks away, clutching his coffee.

passages.name: I want to spend the rest of my life with you
Something kinda serious happened last night.
passages.text:
"Yeah?"  She brings her chair over, sits across from you.  "Want to talk about it?"
You take a deep breath.
[[I was . . . attacked last night.]]
[[I don't think I can talk about it.]]

links.text: I don't think I can talk about it.

destination.name: I don't think I can talk about it.

passages.name: She leaves the room.
passages.text: [[You try your best to get some sleep.|day2]]

links.text: You try your best to get some sleep.

passages.name: I was . . . attacked last night.
passages.text: "I was . . . assaulted last night. By a man on the street. And--" You stop at the sound of the laugh that escapes Bridget's mouth. "Sorry," she says, covering her face--covering her sudden grin. "Sorry. Please, go on." [[As I was saying. . .]] [[Why did you laugh?]]

passages.name: Take a sip.
passages.text: You take a small sip, and almost gag.  Never had scotch on the rocks.  [[Suppose tonight is good of a time as any.|partyend]]

links.text: Suppose tonight is good of a time as any.

passages.name: Sure.
passages.text: She sits up, paying close attention.  "Alright.  Tell me about it."\n[[He wasn't completely happy with the interview.|Jcomplaint]]\n[[He's just been a hardass lately.  Stricter than usual.|Jcomplaint]]

links.text: He wasn't completely happy with the interview.
He's just been a hardass lately.  Stricter than usual.

passages.name: I can't contact the police.  They won't believe me.
passages.text: "Why the hell not?" he asks.  "Look, I have connections on the force.  If you need them, they're yours, no problem."\n[[The man who did this doesn't exist]]\n[[They won't believe me]]

links.text: The man who did this doesn't exist

destination.name: The man who did this doesn't exist

passages.name: What do you mean, a man like me?
passages.text: "Have you looked yourself in the mirror?" she asks.  "You're the spitting image of 'strong dude who takes no shit and loves his girlfriend'.  So it surprises me, I guess.  That you let that happen to you."\n[[That I 'let that happen' to me?]]\n[[It surprises me too.]]

links.text: That I 'let that happen' to me?

destination.name: That I 'let that happen' to me?

passages.name: Amen
passages.text: "Hallelujah," the senator says, raising his glass and taking a shot.  "God is good.  He gave me a drinking body."\n[[And so you drink.|partyend]]

passages.name: Like I said, exclusive recordings.  I got access.

links.text: Not like I have a choice

destination.name: Not like I have a choice

passages.name: Bleave2
passages.text:
She steps out the door.
You look out the empty office.  It feels bigger than usual, too big.  And smaller than usual, like the walls are about to close in on you.
[[Try to write]]
[[Step outside]]

passages.name: Yeah.  That's what I do.
passages.text:
The boy smiles.  "Well, that's awful generous of you.  I appreciate that, I suppose.
"Not really sure how you can help me though."
He looks up at the sky.  "I'm not sure why I'm even still here.  Thought I'd be in heaven the moment I hit the concrete.  But I'm lingering.  It's strange."
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"[[Maybe there's a person you want to speak to one more time?]]"
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"[[Maybe there's something you still want to do in this life?]]"
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

links.text: Maybe there's a person you want to speak to one more time?

destination.name: Maybe there's a person you want to speak to one more time?

links.text: Maybe there's something you still want to do in this life?

destination.name: Maybe there's something you still want to do in this life?

passages.name: Ask her not to touch you.  To find relief.
passages.text:
"Can you move your hand," you ask, trying to sound sleepy, even as your voice is shaking.  "It's bothering me a bit."
"Oh.  Sorry, sweetie."  And her hand retreats away from your body.
You curl up on your side of the bed, your knees against your chest.  Even though she's stopped touching you, you can still feel the hand, tracing down your body and between your legs.
[[It's a few hours before you finally fall asleep.|day2]]

links.text: It's a few hours before you finally fall asleep.

passages.name: That I 'let that happen' to me?
passages.text: "Yeah?  I mean, I guess you could have stopped it."  She shakes her head.  "Nevermind.  Maybe that was a bad choice of words.  Let's not go down this rabbit hole."\n[[Sounds good to me]]\n[[No, let's explore exactly what you meant by that.]]

links.text: No, let's explore exactly what you meant by that.

destination.name: No, let's explore exactly what you meant by that.

passages.name: partyend
passages.text: By the time you think about going home, it's a few hours into the morning.  The senator is long gone.  You stumble out of your chair.  [[It's time to go.|homeghost]]

passages.name: I'm joking.  I did.
passages.text: "Oh."  She laughs with relief.  Awkward silence; she sips her drink.  "Well, I guess I'll have to get used to that sense of humor," she says, smiling at you, "[[when we start spending more time together.|title]]"

links.text: when we start spending more time together.

passages.name: Adler
Someone . . . hurt me tonight.
passages.text: "What?"  She sits up, looking into your eyes.  "Who?!"\n[[Someone I interviewed.]]\n[[Some random guy on the street.]]

links.text: Some random guy on the street.

destination.name: Some random guy on the street.

passages.name: Yep.
passages.text: "Good," Bridget teases. "Maybe next month I'll be on the front page for once."\n[[You wish. I got better sources.]]\n[[You will. You're the better writer.]]

links.text: You wish.  I got better sources.

destination.name: You wish.  I got better sources.

links.text: You will.  You're the better writer.

passages.text: [[One of my earliest memories of my mother was of her painting dogs.|1article2]]

links.text: One of my earliest memories of my mother was of her painting dogs.

passages.name: No, I'm not.
passages.text: She cranes her neck at you.  "Oh?  Have you finally decided to renounce that horrible life?"\n[[Yes.  I'll be straight.]]\n[[You're right, I'm not homosexual.  I'm bisexual.]]

links.text: You're right, I'm not homosexual.  I'm bisexual.

destination.name: You're right, I'm not homosexual.  I'm bisexual.

passages.name: Push it away.
passages.text: You gently push it from in front of you, and place your arms up on the table.

passages.name: Jtrouble
passages.text: Samantha nods.  "Wanna talk about it?"\n[[No.  Let's get some sleep.|Yeah.  Too tired to talk.]]\n[[Sure.]]

passages.name: call in sick from work
passages.text: Soon, the ghosts come to you.  You see worry on their faces, and they surround you, murmuring.\n"We didn't see you today," one of them explains.  "So we thought we'd come to you."

passages.name: Some random guy on the street.
passages.text: "Yeesh."  Samantha sighs.  "I'm really sorry to hear that.  Are you ok?"\n[[Yeah.  I'm fine.]]\n[[No.  I don't think so.]]

passages.name: Try to write
passages.text: You place a sheet of paper in the type writer and let the incident pour from your brain onto the paper. It gushes out of you, bringing tears and tightness with it. You can't bring yourself to write that it was a man who did this to you. To say that some part of you liked it. And that maybe some part of you let it happen. Because to do that would be admitting that you have something terrible inside of you--a faggot wrapped tightly in a heterosexual shell. Everyone says you have to choose, after all. One or the other. Can't switch between them forever. Finally, you stop writing. You look at the paper, but can't reread it. Instead you yank it out of the typewriter and place it on your desk. You have the urge to be away right now. [[Go to the bathroom]] [[Go outside, take a walk|Step outside]]

passages.name: Why do you ask?
passages.text: The ghost shrugs. He steps closer to you, gazing at you with chesnut eyes. "'Cuz I want to leave. And you can help me do that."\nHe reaches out, and puts a hand on your shoulder. "So they were right," he says with surprise. "You can be touched by us."\n[[He smiles.|FUCK]]

passages.name: sleepgf
passages.text: She lays down, and you lay down next to her. Her arm trails onto your hip, the same way his did before.\n[[Lean into her. To find comfort.]]\n[[Ask her not to touch you. To find relief.]]

links.text: Lean into her.  To find comfort.

destination.name: Lean into her.  To find comfort.

links.text: Ask her not to touch you.  To find relief.

destination.name: Ask her not to touch you.  To find relief.

passages.name: You might be right
passages.text: Bridget nods.

passages.name: the one who's closer to a friend than a coworker.
passages.text: "Hey there."  Bridget is writing at her desk when you enter, her typewriter clack-clacking away at something wonderous.  "You look like shit," she says as you sit at your station across from her.  "What, did your secret recording stash run out?"\n[[No, it's not that.]]\n[[Yep, you got me.]]

passages.name: Typewriter-remington-riviera.regular
Yes.  I mean, I think so.
passages.text:
"Yes.  I mean, I think so."
Her frown deepens.  "Ok.  I don't know why you're interested in me then."  She stands up.
"Wait--"
"It was nice meeting you," she says abruptly.  [[Then, she walks away.|title]]

passages.name: Yeah.  But I don't really know what I can do to help you.

links.text: What did you want from killing yourself?

destination.name: What did you want from killing yourself?

passages.name: I need to take a shower
passages.text: You go shower.  You scrub hard, hard, harder.  [[But you can't get his kiss out of your mouth, can't get his grip from between your legs.|bed]]

links.text: But you can't get his kiss out of your mouth, can't get his grip from between your legs.

passages.name: bed
passages.text:
You walk to the bed.  Your girlfriend's already there, and she pats your spot, gesturing you to come.  You obey, sitting down.
"So how was work?" she asks, putting an arm around you.
[[It was good.]]
[[I don't want to talk about it.]]

links.text: I don't want to talk about it.

destination.name: I don't want to talk about it.

passages.name: Why did you kill yourself?
passages.text: "That easy. I needed to end myself," he says, his face flat. "The . . . me that was holding myself back." "Then maybe that thing isn't letting you rest," you say to him. The boy's eyes widen. ". . . You might be right," he says finally." "Think about it," you tell him. "Find out what it is specifically. The others will tell me once you realize what's keeping you here. And then I'll be back to help." [[With that, you exit the balcony, and leave the party.|homeghost]]

links.text: With that, you exit the balcony, and leave the party.

passages.name: Haven't quite celebrated it since she passed.
passages.text: Your editor nods, understanding.  "It's the same with my father.  Their days are never the same without them, are they?"\nHe shakes his head.  Then, he quickly says, "Alright, get out of here.  We got lots to do."\nHe places your interview on his desk and starts working on something else.  [[Your signal to leave.|You leave his office.]]

passages.name: Fuck you.
passages.text: Bridget's eyes widen in surprise.  "Actually, maybe I earned that," she admitted after a moment.  "Sorry.  I shouldn't be laughing."

passages.name: Sounds good to me
passages.text:
Bridget sighs with relief.  "Ok.  Thanks."
Silence.  Both of you shift in your seats.  Then, "So, what are you going to do?" Bridget asks.  "About what happened?"
[[I don't know.  Something.]]
[[Not much I can do.  Not really]]

links.text: Not much I can do.  Not really

destination.name: Not much I can do.  Not really

passages.name: day4new
passages.text: <>You don't sleep--you can't sleep anymore. Instead you wait for the sun to rise.<>You wake up. Today's your day off.<>\nYou go to the graveyard, and find your family tombstone. Like every year, [[your mother is waiting there, her arms folded, her eyes cross.|momtalk]]

links.text: your mother is waiting there, her arms folded, her eyes cross.

passages.name: They won't believe me
passages.text: Jacobson shrugs.  "Maybe not.  But it's worth a shot, isn't it?  The woman who did this to you shouldn't get away with . . . that."\n[[I guess you're right.]]\n[[Like I said, they won't believe me]]

links.text: Like I said, they won't believe me

destination.name: Like I said, they won't believe me

passages.name: Keep the casual Friday clothes on.
passages.text: You adjust your rumpled collar and inspect a coffee stain on your shirt.  Maybe not good enough for this party.  But good enough for your purposes.\n[[It's time to go.|]]\n<<set $shirt to 1>>

passages.name: You know why I'm here?
passages.text:
The boy nods.  "Yeah.  They told me about you.  You're gonna help me get to the other side."
He laughs.  "Not sure how exactly you'll achieve that when I failed to get there myself."  He shakes his head.  "Thought I'd be in heaven the second my head hit the concrete.  But I'm stuck down here."

"[[Maybe there's a person you want to speak to one more time?]]"

passages.name: Resist him
passages.text: You try to pull away but he tightens his grip on you--how can a ghost be so strong--and you squirm but instead of letting go he goes deeper, pressing his cold body against yours, taking you.\nHe smiles around your lips. Still holding you close, he runs a hand down your back, to your arm, down your chest, [[stopping at the erect thing between your legs.|assault]]

links.text: stopping at the erect thing between your legs.

passages.name: Change into a good suit.
passages.text: You take your Backup Outfit from your drawers and quickly change in the bathroom.  Soon enough, you look good enough to go to a wedding.\n[[9:20pm.  Better start moving.|It's time to go.]]\n<<set $suit to 1>>

passages.name: ~Bi Lines Style Guide~
1article3
passages.text: I was excited by the dogs, but was told I could only watch them, not play with them. As I watched, I saw two dogs nuzzling one another. I remembered what my mother had told me about babies, and said, "[[Those two dogs like one another. Are they gonna make a puppy?|1article4]]"

links.text: Those two dogs like one another.  Are they gonna make a puppy?

passages.name: I don't want to talk about it.
passages.text: She nods.  "Long day, huh?"\n[[Yeah.  Too tired to talk.]]\n[[Something bad happened today.]]

passages.name: Do what you came for.  Focus.
passages.text: You straighten your <<if $shirt is 1>>mustard-stained <<else>><<endif>>tie and look around the room.  It's time.\nTrying to be casual, you walk through the hoard of fancy partygoers, to the edge of the hall.  Just like the ghosts said, there is a balcony door.\n[[You open it.]]

passages.name: They see you.
passages.text: Spirits rise hesitantly from the alleyways.  All of them watch you, waiting for your signal.\n[[With one tiny wave of your finger, they approach.|]]

links.text: With one tiny wave of your finger, they approach.

passages.name: write
passages.text: "Might help to write it down. Just some advice." She smiles. She leaves. You place a sheet of paper in the type writer and let the incident pour from your brain onto the paper. It gushes out of you, bringing tears and tightness with it. You can't bring yourself to write that it was a man who did this to you. To say that some part of you liked it. And that maybe some part of you let it happen. Because to do that would be admitting that you have something terrible inside of you--a faggot wrapped tightly in a heterosexual shell. Everyone says you have to choose, after all. One or the other. Can't switch between them forever. Finally, you stop writing. You look at the paper, but can't reread it. Instead you yank it out of the typewriter and place it on your desk. You have the urge to be away right now. [[Go to the bathroom]] [[Go outside, take a walk]] <>

passages.name: No.  I mean, I don't think I am.
Sounds good to me.
passages.text:
The bartender smiles.  "Alrighty."  He turns away, and you watch him make your drink, your fingers tapping impatiently on the table as you see his body move, elegant and swift.
A moment later, he places the drink in front of you with his large, hairy fingers.  His hand looks like it would be so soft to hold.
"Enjoy," the bartender says.  Then, without looking back, he walks over to the next person waiting to drown themselves in alcohol.
You sigh into your drink.  Now the scotch, a signifier of the bartender, mocks you.
[[Push it away.]]
[[Take a sip.]]

passages.name: Yeah.  Sorry.
passages.text: "Oh."  She finishes her drink, and stands up.  "I guess I'll be going then.  It was good to meet you."\nShe walks away.\nYou let out a sigh of relief.  [[Travesty avoided.|title]]

passages.name: gfmad
passages.text: She ignores you, springing out of bed like a distressed cat. "And you never told me?!" she shouts. "You piece of shit!"\n[[Just because I like guys too doesn't mean I liked what . . . what he did!|gfmad2]]\n[[Look, I never meant to hurt you.|gfmad2]]

links.text: Just because I like guys too doesn't mean I liked what . . . what he did!
Look, I never meant to hurt you.

passages.name: Take out your notebook.  Write down their words.
passages.text: You take out your notebook and try to ignore the choking feeling in your stomach.  You write down what the ghosts are saying, breathing fast and hard, your handwring reduced to scribbles by the panic.\nNone of them seem to notice.  One by one they report to you, and soon you have a list of prospects and interview times.  Ian Knox wants to meet with you in an hour.  Lovely.\nWhen they finish, the ghosts disperse.  You are left alone.  As you lower your notebook and pencil back into your pocket, [[you notice your hands are shaking.|backinoffice]]

links.text: you notice your hands are shaking.

passages.name: You've reached the party
passages.text: The building is tall and glowing, with doormen in suits guarding the entrance from commoners.  <<if $suit is 1>>They nod in approval at your outfit.<<else>>They look at you in slight disgust as you approach, and one of them wrinkles their nose at your stained pants.<<endif>>  \nYou take out your press badge and show it to the doorman.  He nods, and steps aside.  "Welcome," he says quietly.  "[[Enjoy the party.|]]"

passages.name: Go to the bathroom
passages.text: You step in the men's room, a tiny space with a urinal and a toilet.  You sit down on the toilet and take a deep breath.  Worthless thoughts prod at your brain, sapping away your confidence and threatening to overwhelm you.\n[[Let them come.  No point in fighting it.]]\n[[Try to think about something else.  Need to find some calm.]]

links.text: Let them come.  No point in fighting it.

destination.name: Let them come.  No point in fighting it.

links.text: Try to think about something else.  Need to find some calm.

destination.name: Try to think about something else.  Need to find some calm.

passages.name: I don't know.  Something.
passages.text: "Oh."  Bridget squirms.  "I see.  Sorry."\nAwkward.  Finally, she stands up, and puts her chair back behind her desk. \n

passages.name: Is that why you made them talk to me?  Because you want me to be like you?
Think she'll be alright?
passages.text: Jacobson nods.  "She'll be fine.  She's a tough one, you know."

passages.name: I don't think I can talk about it.
passages.text: "You sure?" Bridget leans forward, puts a hand on your shoulder. "Because it looks like you can talk about it, but you're holding yourself back. Is that right? Or am I completely wrong?"\n[[You might be right]]\n[[I can't. Talk. About. It.]]

passages.name: Yep, you got me.
passages.text: "Ha!"  She grins, looks up at your triumphantly.  "Wait, are you serious?"\n[[Yep.]]\n[[Nope.]]

passages.name: Of course I do.
passages.text: Your editor nods. "Of course, of course. And if you find any interviews of her, put them in the piece. That would be quite an exclusive.\n"Alright, get out of here. We got lots to do." He places your interview on his desk and starts working on something else. [[Your signal to leave.|You leave his office.]]

passages.name: Shower
passages.text: You go shower.  You scrub hard, hard, harder.  [[But you can't get his kiss out of your mouth, can't get his grip from between your legs.|bedalone]]

links.text: But you can't get his kiss out of your mouth, can't get his grip from between your legs.

passages.name: assault
passages.text: And then suddenly you are released. You gasp for breath. You hear him let out a sigh of contentment, like he has just had a very, very good meal. You look up at him. The ghost grins. But before you can say anything, his body starts to fade. [[And in a moment, he's gone from this plane.|]]

links.text: And in a moment, he's gone from this plane.

destination.name: And in a moment, he's gone from this plane.

passages.name: But I'll be fine after I get some sleep.
passages.text: Samantha nods, breathing out a relieved sigh.  "Good.  That's good to hear.  [[Let's get some sleep.|sleepgf]]"

passages.name: giving you a thankful smile.
passages.text: You smile in relief hearing that.\nAside from your transcribing, you don't interact with them beyond the occasional nod and smile.  After all, [[you're the only human who can see and touch them]]--you've long learned it looks strange to talk and interact with invisible people.

links.text: you're the only human who can see and touch them

passages.name: Let's just stick around here.
passages.text: She shrugs.  "Alright.  Sounds good to me."\n\n[[And you talk the night away.|title]]

links.text: And you talk the night away.

passages.name: Then again, Jacobson lets you write those interviews every issue.  Which is why you came here in the first place.
passages.text:
You check the time.  9pm.  The other writers are either out getting drinks or getting stories.  And you've got a party to go to.
Of course, you got a nice outfit saved in your desk drawers, just in case of assignments like these.  But for this party, it might be good to stand out in your ink-stained khakis.

passages.name: Ok.  It can be our secret.
Lean into her.  To find comfort.
passages.text: You lean into her arm, trying to find some sembelance of togetherness.\nBut even lying against her, you feel dirty and alone.\n[[It takes hours before you fall asleep.|day2]]

links.text: It takes hours before you fall asleep.

passages.name: gfmad2
passages.text:
"Oh, so you admit it."  Dark triumph fills her face.  "You're really a queer."
She walks to the door.  "I'm going to sleep on the couch," she says.  "I can't stay in here tonight."
[[She leaves the room.]]
<<set $breakup to 1>>

passages.name: Just some trouble with Jacobson.  It'll work out.
passages.text: "Well, it better," Samantha says.  "Jacobson's pretty tough, isn't he?"\n[[Yeah, he is.  I'm a little worried.|Jtrouble]]\n[[Yeah, he is.  But things will be fine.|Jtrouble]]

links.text: Yeah, he is.  I'm a little worried.
Yeah, he is.  But things will be fine.

passages.name: You wish.  I got better sources.
passages.text: "You're right about that," she says. She drifts off, a thoughtful look on her face. "You do have better sources. . ."

passages.name: Sure, I'll drink with you.
passages.text:
At the bar, you drink with the senator.  He talks about his life with you, his grey eyebrows furrowing as he discusses his marriages, his time in congress, his career.
"You're lucky you're young," he says, taking another shot.  "You got plenty of time to figure yourself out.  Young people don't know themselves, not really.  When you're older you'll understand."
You catch the eye of the attractive girl across the bar, and the handsome guy.
[[I suppose you're right, Senator.]]
[[I've already figured out some things about myself.]]

links.text: I've already figured out some things about myself.

destination.name: I've already figured out some things about myself.

passages.name: day1-1
passages.text:
"I don't know how you find this stuff," Jacobson grunts.  Your editor in chief leans back in his chair, smoking a cigar as he reads the interview once again.  "Amazing.  It's always amazing."  He looks up at you with iron eyes.  "But Sandy Richards is dead, last I checked.  You gonna tell me how you got this interview?"
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"[[Like I said, exclusive recordings.  I got access.]]"
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"[[Like I said, it's a secret.  I have connections.]]"
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

links.text: Like I said, it's a secret.  I have connections.

destination.name: Like I said, it's a secret.  I have connections.

passages.name: Sleep
passages.text: You collaspe on your tattered couch and lean your head against the arm.  You still feel filthy.  But you don't deserve to be clean.\n[[You close your eyes.  And soon, you drift off.|day2]]

links.text: You close your eyes.  And soon, you drift off.

passages.name: . . . Yeah.  Exactly.
passages.text: "What a relief," Jacobson slaps you on the back, almost spilling your coffee.  "I almost thought I was going to lose my best writer for a while.  Well, it's very well written.  You really captured the female perspective."\nWith that, he walks away to his office.

passages.name: I doubt I can find an interview.
passages.text: "Mother was very private about her work, so there aren't many recorded interviews with her," you explain.  "But I'm working on the piece the best I can."\n"Good, good."  Your editor smiles.  "You've always been a resilient type.\n"Alright, get out of here.  We got lots to do." He places your interview on his desk and starts working on something else.  [[Your signal to leave.|You leave his office.]]

passages.name: day3new
passages.text:
<<if $dead is 1>>Your eyes open.  You're still on the edge of the bridge.
But your body is different.
You look down.  You're clear, translucent.  And floating above the ground.
It appears your soul still has something it needs here.
<<else>>You wake up.  You feel more misrable than yesterday.<<endif>>
